article_node.title: SHAREHOLDER INVESTIGATION: Halper Sadeh LLC Investigates DAY and BKH on Behalf of Shareholders
article_node.summary: Halper Sadeh LLC, an investor‑rights law firm, is investigating whether Dayforce Inc.’s $70‑per‑share sale to Thoma Bravo and Black Hills Corp.’s merger with NorthWestern Energy Group breached federal securities laws or fiduciary duties. The firm says it can seek higher consideration, additional disclosures, or other relief for shareholders on a contingent‑fee basis. It invites affected shareholders to contact the firm for free legal advice and highlights its track record of recovering millions for investors harmed by securities fraud.
